overview.description: A Victorian-era industrial aesthetic that evokes the atmosphere of a 19th-century factory or workshop. The design combines the warmth of aged parchment and leather with the cold precision of brass machinery, creating a unique blend of organic and mechanical elements.
overview.mood: Authoritative yet approachable, technical yet warm, industrial yet refined

materialHonesty.description: Every surface should feel like a real material - metal plates, parchment, leather, or polished brass. Use gradients and shadows to simulate depth and physical presence.
materialHonesty.application: Buttons look like pressed metal plates, cards feel like paper on a desk, dividers appear as industrial metal bars

functionalOrnamentation.description: Decorative elements should reinforce the industrial theme while serving a purpose. Rivets mark boundaries, brass borders indicate interactive areas, metal bars separate content sections.
functionalOrnamentation.application: Rivets appear at corners of important containers, brass borders highlight interactive cards on hover, industrial dividers create visual rhythm

hierarchicalClarity.description: Use the contrast between dark metal (header/footer) and light parchment (content) to create clear visual hierarchy. Important actions use bright brass, secondary elements use muted tones.
hierarchicalClarity.application: Dark header anchors the page, light content areas invite reading, brass CTAs draw attention

craftedMotion.description: Animations should feel mechanical and precise, like well-oiled machinery. Movements ease out smoothly (like a steam valve releasing) rather than bouncing or springing.
craftedMotion.application: Use ease-out-expo for most transitions, stagger animations like gears engaging, subtle pulsing for ambient elements

accessibleByDefault.description: The design must work for everyone. Respect user preferences for reduced motion, maintain sufficient color contrast, and ensure all interactive elements are keyboard accessible.
accessibleByDefault.application: Reduced motion media query disables animations, focus states use visible brass outlines, text maintains WCAG AA contrast

surfaces.parchment: Light, warm backgrounds (#E8DCC8, #F5E6D3) that feel like aged paper
surfaces.metalDark: Deep brown-black gradients (#3E2723 to #5D4037) for header/footer bars
surfaces.metalLight: Cream-to-tan gradients for secondary buttons and neutral surfaces
surfaces.brass: Golden metallic gradients (#D4A574 to #8B6914) for primary actions

textures.insetShadow: Subtle inner shadows create the feeling of recessed surfaces (pressed buttons, code blocks)
textures.dropShadow: Soft outer shadows lift elements off the page (cards, modals)
textures.metalSheen: Top-edge highlights (rgba white) simulate light catching polished metal

borders.brassAccent: 3-4px solid brass borders mark important boundaries and interactive states
borders.subtleBorder: 2px borders in muted brown (#8B7355) define card and input edges
borders.gradientBar: Horizontal brass-to-copper gradients create elegant section dividers

decorativeElements.rivets: Circular brass/bronze radial gradients with inset shadows, 10-16px diameter
decorativeElements.industrialBars: Horizontal dark metal bars with brass top/bottom borders
decorativeElements.emDashes: Brass-colored em dashes (—) flank important titles

typography.philosophy: Blend Victorian elegance with modern readability. Display text uses ornate serifs for gravitas, body text uses traditional serifs for comfort, code uses modern monospace for clarity.

displayFont.characteristics: Wide letter-spacing (0.05-0.15em), uppercase for nav/buttons, all-caps sparingly

bodyFont.characteristics: Comfortable 1.7 line-height, slightly larger base size (17px)

monoFont.usage: Code blocks, inline code, technical identifiers

scale.principle: Use clamp() for fluid sizing that respects viewport width

colorPhilosophy.warmFoundation: The palette is built on warm browns and tans that evoke aged paper and leather, creating a comfortable reading environment.
colorPhilosophy.metallicAccents: Brass, bronze, and copper provide the industrial character. These should feel like actual metals - warm gold tones with subtle color variation.
colorPhilosophy.functionalColor: Accent colors (deep rust red) draw attention to links and important actions. The neon green subline provides a modern tech contrast that makes the brand memorable.
colorPhilosophy.darkAnchors: Deep brown-black tones ground the design at header and footer, creating a frame that contains the lighter content.

spacingPhilosophy.generousWhitespace: Content needs room to breathe. The industrial elements are dense, so surrounding whitespace is essential for balance.
spacingPhilosophy.consistentRhythm: Use a 4px base unit (0.25rem) scaled by powers of 2: 4, 8, 16, 32, 64px
spacingPhilosophy.sectionSeparation: Major sections separated by industrial bar dividers with 4rem (64px) vertical padding
spacingPhilosophy.componentPadding: Cards and containers use 2rem (32px) padding; buttons use proportional internal padding

interactionPhilosophy.hoverFeedback: Interactive elements lift slightly (translateY -2 to -4px) and gain brass accents on hover, like metal catching light.
interactionPhilosophy.pressFeedback: Buttons compress slightly on press (scale 0.98, translateY 1px) simulating mechanical button depression.
interactionPhilosophy.focusVisibility: Focus states use brass outlines with soft glow halos - visible without being jarring.
interactionPhilosophy.transitionTiming: Fast for color/opacity changes (150ms), medium for transforms (250ms), slow for complex shadow transitions (400ms)

responsivePhilosophy.mobileFirst: Core experience works on small screens; decorative elements (rivets, em-dashes) hide on mobile.
responsivePhilosophy.contentPriority: Navigation collapses to vertical stack, sidebars move above content, images scale down.
responsivePhilosophy.touchTargets: Buttons and links sized for comfortable touch (min 44px tap target).
responsivePhilosophy.breakpoint: 768px is the primary breakpoint between mobile and desktop layouts.

brandElements.logo: Site name flanked by brass em-dashes: — Gas Town Hall —
brandElements.heroSubline: Neon green (#39FF14) monospace text with dark outline stroke - the memorable brand accent
brandElements.industrialDivider: Dark metal bar with brass borders and central rotating rivet

aiImplementationGuidelines.newComponents: When creating new components, start with the surface (parchment or metal), add appropriate borders (brass for interactive, subtle for static), include material-honest shadows, and ensure hover/focus states use brass accents.
aiImplementationGuidelines.colorSelection: Pull from the defined palette. When in doubt, use brass for emphasis, muted brown for secondary, rust red for links/actions.
aiImplementationGuidelines.animationApproach: Use the defined easing curves. Entrance animations should fade + slide (fadeInUp/Down). Hover animations should lift + brighten. Keep durations short (150-400ms).
aiImplementationGuidelines.typographyRules: Cinzel for anything that needs authority (headings, buttons, navigation). Crimson Text for comfortable reading. JetBrains Mono only for code.
aiImplementationGuidelines.accessibilityChecklist: Include focus-visible states, respect prefers-reduced-motion, maintain 4.5:1 contrast for text, provide skip links.
